question_text: A pencil is about 15cm long. A rubber is about 3cm long. Which is longer?
An apple weighs about 150g. A grape weighs about 5g. Which is heavier?
A bottle holds 500ml of water. A spoon holds 5ml. Which has a larger capacity?
A chocolate bar costs £1. A packet of crisps costs 50p. Which item is more expensive?
A ruler is 30cm long. A book is 25cm long. Which is shorter?
If a bag of sugar is 1kg and a bag of crisps is 30g, which item has a lighter weight?
A jug holds 1 litre of juice. A glass holds 200ml. Which holds less?
A toy car costs £5. A real car costs £5000. Which costs more?
What is the total cost of an apple at 30p and a banana at 20p?
A piece of string is 10cm long. Another piece is 8cm long. What is their total length?
You pour 100ml of water and 50ml of juice into a glass. What is the total volume of liquid?
A bag of sweets weighs 200g. You eat 50g. How much do the remaining sweets weigh?
You have £1. You spend 50p. How much money do you have left?
A rope is 20m long. You cut off 5m. How much rope is left?
A bottle contained 500ml of milk. You drank 100ml. How much milk is left?
Which is a reasonable estimate for the height of a classroom door: 2 metres or 20 metres?
Which is a reasonable estimate for the weight of an adult cat: 4 grams or 4 kilograms?
Estimate the capacity of a kitchen sink. Is it closer to 10 litres or 100 litres?
You buy a comic for £2 and a magazine for £3. What is the total cost?
A fence panel is 2m wide. You put two panels side-by-side. What is the total width?
An orange weighs 150g and a lemon weighs 100g. What is their total weight?
You have £10. You get £5 for your birthday. How much do you have in total?
A book is 3cm thick. Another book is 4cm thick. What is the total thickness?
A cup holds 250ml. You pour out 50ml. How much is left?
A bar of chocolate weighs 100g. You eat a 20g piece. How much is left?
A garden is 8m long and 5m wide. What is the total distance if you walk all the way around the edge (the perimeter)?
You buy two items costing £1.50 and £2.00. What is the total cost?
A plank of wood is 2m long. You cut off a piece that is 50cm long. How much is left in metres?
A bag of flour weighs 1kg. You use 300g for a recipe. How much is left in grams?
A bottle contains 1 litre of juice. You pour a 250ml glass and a 200ml glass. How much is left in the bottle in ml?
What is the total cost of three pens at 60p each?
You have a £10 note and buy a book for £6.50. How much change do you receive?
Estimate the total length of 4 pencils, if one pencil is about 15cm long.
Which is heavier: 3 bags of apples weighing 500g each, or a 1kg bag of sugar?
A recipe needs 1 litre of milk. You have a 750ml carton. How much more milk do you need?
How many 20p coins make £2?
A fence is made of 5 panels, each 2m long. What is the total length of the fence?
A box contains 8 books, each weighing 200g. What is the total weight of the books in grams?
You pour three 250ml glasses of water from a 1 litre bottle. How much water is left?
Which is a better estimate for the weight of a bicycle: 15kg or 150kg?
A ribbon is 3m long. You cut it into 6 equal pieces. How long is each piece in cm?
A shopping bill is £8.75. You pay with a £10 note. What is your change?
A jug contains 1.5 litres of water. You pour out 800ml. How much is left in ml?
A bag of 4 apples weighs 600g. Estimate the weight of one apple.
You run 500m every day. How many kilometres do you run in 10 days?
Which costs more: 4 sweets at 20p each, or 1 chocolate bar at 90p?
How many 250ml glasses can you fill from a 1.5 litre bottle?
A tower is built with 10 blocks, each 5cm tall. How tall is the tower?
A car has 4 litres of fuel. The journey uses 2500ml. How much fuel is left in litres?
A recipe requires 1.2kg of potatoes. You have a 2kg bag. How much will be left over in grams?
You need 2.5kg of flour for a large cake. You have one 1kg bag and one 800g bag. How much more flour do you need in grams?
A family drinks 1.5 litres of milk per day. How many millilitres do they drink in a week?
A rectangular room is 4m long and 3.5m wide. What is its perimeter?
A shopping trip costs £23.45. You pay with a £20 note and a £5 note. How much change do you get?
A long journey is 450km. If you travel at an average speed of 90km per hour, how many hours will the journey take?
A box contains 12 tins of soup, each weighing 400g. If the box itself weighs 200g, what is the total weight in kilograms?
Petrol costs £1.50 per litre. You put 20 litres in your car. What is the total cost?
Which is the better value: a 2-litre bottle of cola for £2.00, or a 1.5-litre bottle for £1.80?
A tap drips 5ml of water every minute. How much water does it waste in a full day, in litres?
A running track is 400m long. To run 5km, how many full laps do you need to complete?
You need to make 3 litres of squash. The instructions say to use 1 part concentrate to 4 parts water. How much concentrate do you need in ml?
A pack of 8 batteries costs £5.60. What is the cost per battery?
A plank is 5m long. You cut it into pieces that are 80cm long. How many full 80cm pieces can you cut?
A car travels 12km on 1 litre of fuel. If it has 5 litres in the tank, how far can it travel?
Estimate the total weight of a class of 30 children, if the average child weighs about 40kg.
A phone bill is £15 per month plus 10p per minute for extra calls. If you make 30 minutes of extra calls, what is the total bill?
A garden measures 10m by 12m. What is its area in square metres?
A train travels 200km in 2.5 hours. What is its average speed in km per hour?
You mix 500g of flour with 250g of sugar and 150g of butter. What is the total weight of the mixture in kg?
A swimming pool is 25m long. How many lengths do you need to swim to complete 1km?
A film starts at 18:45 and ends at 21:05. How long is the film in hours and minutes?
A cube has a side length of 10cm. What is its volume?
You get a 10% discount on a £40 item. How much do you pay?
A map has a scale where 1cm represents 2km. The distance on the map is 8.5cm. What is the real distance?
A water tank holds 500 litres. It is 75% full. How many litres of water are in the tank?
A rectangular field is 120m long and has a perimeter of 400m. What is its width?
A car's fuel tank holds 50 litres. It uses fuel at a rate of 8 litres per 100km. If you start with a full tank and drive 350km, how much fuel is left?
The exchange rate is £1 = €1.15. You want to buy a camera that costs €230. How much will it cost in pounds?
A recipe for 4 people requires 500g of pasta. How much pasta would you need for 10 people?
You invest £2000 in a savings account with 5% annual interest. How much money will you have after one year?
A fish tank is a cuboid measuring 80cm long, 50cm wide, and 40cm high. What is its volume in litres?
A runner completes a 10km race in 45 minutes. What was their average speed in kilometres per hour?
A shop offers a buy 2 get 1 free deal on T-shirts that cost £12 each. What is the effective cost per T-shirt if you get 3?
A cylindrical water butt is 1.5m high and has a volume of 300 litres. If it currently contains 120 litres, how high is the water level in cm?
A car is sold for £8,000, which is a 20% loss on its original price. What was the original price?
The population of a town grew from 25,000 to 28,000. What was the percentage increase?
A map scale is 1:50,000. The distance between two points on the map is 6cm. What is the real distance in kilometres?
A bath is being filled at a rate of 15 litres per minute. It has a capacity of 120 litres. How long will it take to fill?
A circular pond has a radius of 5m. What is its area? (Use π ≈ 3.14)
A company's share price increased by 15% from £2.00. What is the new share price?
A room requires 24 square metres of carpet. The carpet costs £18 per square metre. What is the total cost?
A recipe needs flour, sugar, and butter in the ratio 3:2:1. If you use 150g of butter, how much flour do you need?
A car depreciates in value by 20% in its first year. If it was bought for £15,000, what is its value after one year?
You mix 2 litres of orange juice with 500ml of pineapple juice. What is the percentage of pineapple juice in the final mixture?
A journey of 200 miles takes 4 hours. How long would a journey of 350 miles take at the same average speed?
A phone costs £500 plus 20% VAT. What is the total price?
A builder mixes sand and cement in a 4:1 ratio. If he uses 80kg of sand, how much cement does he need?
The area of a rectangle is 48 cm². Its length is 8cm. What is its perimeter?
A water tank is a cylinder with a radius of 1m and a height of 2m. What is its volume in cubic metres? (Use π ≈ 3.14)
A train travels at 120km/h. How many kilometres does it travel in 2 hours and 15 minutes?
Which is longer, a pencil or a table?
Which is heavier, a feather or a book?
Which takes a longer time: brushing your teeth or sleeping at night?
Look at your hand and your foot. Which one is longer?
What unit might you use to measure the length of your finger if you did not have a ruler?
Is a car heavier or lighter than a bicycle?
Which container holds more water: a cup or a bucket?
Does it take a shorter time to clap your hands or to eat your lunch?
My book is 5 blocks long. Your book is 7 blocks long. Whose book is longer?
An apple is put on a balance scale with a stone. The apple goes up. Which is heavier?
Which event takes longer: watching a film or tying your shoelaces?
To measure how tall a door is, would it be better to use paperclips or footsteps?
Which is lighter: a chair or a sofa?
Which holds less: a teaspoon or a jug?
Which happens in a shorter amount of time: blinking or reading a book?
A tower is 10 cubes high. A car is 3 cubes high. Which is taller?
A bag of sugar feels heavier than a bag of crisps. Which has more mass?
Which takes a very short time: counting to 3 or counting to 100?
Which is taller, a giraffe or a cat?
A brick and a sponge are the same size. Which do you think is heavier?
Does a swimming pool hold more or less water than a bath?
What is a long time for a journey: one minute or one hour?
My desk is 8 handspans wide. The window is 12 handspans wide. Which is wider?
You have a bag of feathers and a bag of stones. Which is lighter?
Which is a short time: one second or one hour?
A pencil measures 15 centimetres. Write this measurement down.
A bag of flour weighs 1 kilogram. Write this measurement down.
A bottle holds 500 millilitres of water. Write this measurement down.
You look at an analogue clock. The big hand is on the 12 and the little hand is on the 3. What time is it?
A ruler shows a line is 8 cm long. How do you write this?
A scale shows a weight of 5 kilograms. How do you write this?
A measuring jug has 1 litre of liquid. How do you write this?
An event takes 30 seconds. Write this measurement of time.
You measure a book to be 25 cm high. How do you record this?
The mass of a cat is 4 kg. How would you write that down?
A swimming race took 58 seconds. Record this time.
A carton of juice holds 1 litre. How would you record this capacity?
Which is a unit of length: kilograms or metres?
Which is a unit of mass: seconds or grams?
Which is a unit of capacity: litres or centimetres?
Which is a unit of time: kilograms or minutes?
A door is about 2 metres tall. Write this measurement.
A small bag of sugar is 500 grams. Write this mass.
The clock shows half past four. How would you write this digitally?
Which is heavier, 1 kilogram or 1 gram?
Which is longer, 1 centimetre or 1 metre?
Which is more, 1 litre or 1 millilitre?
A lesson lasts for 1 hour. Write this down.
A ruler is 30 centimetres long. Record this length.
A bag of apples weighs 2 kg. Record this mass.
A piece of wood is 1 metre and 25 centimetres long. Record its length in metres.
A weight is 2 kilograms and 500 grams. Record this mass in kilograms.
A jug holds 1 litre and 500 millilitres. Record this capacity in litres.
A film lasts for 1 hour and 30 minutes. How many minutes is this in total?
A snake is 1m 10cm long. Write its length in centimetres only.
A bag contains 3kg 50g of potatoes. How many grams is this in total?
A bucket holds 2l 250ml of water. How many millilitres is this?
A meeting starts at 9:00 AM and finishes at 10:15 AM. How long did it last in minutes?
A table is 1.5 metres long. What is this length in centimetres?
A box weighs 2.2 kg. What is this weight in grams?
A bottle contains 1.75 litres of juice. What is this capacity in millilitres?
A race took 2 minutes and 10 seconds. How many seconds was the race?
Record the length one and a quarter metres in centimetres.
Record the mass three and a half kilograms in grams.
A journey took 120 minutes. How many hours is this?
A fence is 300 cm long. Record its length in metres.
A bag of sand weighs 5000 grams. Record its mass in kilograms.
A large pot holds 4000 ml. Record its capacity in litres.
A song is 180 seconds long. How many minutes is this?
A boy is 1.4 metres tall. What is his height in centimetres?
A cake needs 250g of butter. How many kilograms is this?
A race starts at 2:30 PM and ends at 3:00 PM. How many seconds did it last?
Which is longer: 1200 metres or 1 kilometre?
Which is heavier: 1.5 kilograms or 1600 grams?
Which holds more: 2.5 litres or 2400 millilitres?
A runner completes a lap in 1 minute and 15 seconds. If she runs 4 laps at the same pace, what is her total time in minutes?
A carpenter has a piece of wood 2 metres long. He cuts off 75cm. How much is left, in metres?
A box contains 12 cans, each weighing 400g. What is the total weight of the cans in kilograms?
A tap drips 5ml of water every minute. How much water does it drip in one hour, in litres?
A train journey starts at 09:45 and ends at 11:15. How long was the journey in hours?
The perimeter of a square field is 2 kilometres. What is the length of one side in metres?
A bag of potatoes weighs 2.5 kg. A bag of carrots weighs 800g. What is their total weight in kilograms?
A swimming pool is filled at a rate of 100 litres per hour. How long will it take to fill a 1,500 litre pool?
A film lasts 135 minutes. If it starts at 7:00 PM, what time does it finish?
A path is 1.8km long. If you walk 2/3 of the path, how many metres have you walked?
A cake recipe needs 0.25kg of flour. How many cakes can you make from a 2kg bag of flour?
A bottle contains 1.5 litres of liquid. You pour out 3 glasses of 200ml each. How much is left in the bottle in litres?
A flight takes 4 hours and 45 minutes. How many minutes is the flight?
A rectangle has a length of 2m and a width of 50cm. What is its perimeter in metres?
A box weighs 1.2kg. It contains 10 books, each weighing 100g. What is the total weight of the box and books in kg?
A container holds 5 litres. It is 3/4 full. How many millilitres of liquid are in the container?
A meeting was scheduled to last 90 minutes. It overran by 25%. How long did the meeting last in minutes?
A spider crawls 50cm in 30 seconds. If it keeps this pace, how far will it crawl in 5 minutes in metres?
A recipe for 4 people needs 500g of pasta. How much pasta is needed for 5 people, in kilograms?
A car travels at 60 miles per hour. How long does it take to travel 15 miles, in minutes?
A jug contains 2 litres of water. 25% is used. How many millilitres are left?
The total length of 8 identical pipes is 12 metres. What is the length of one pipe in centimetres?
A bucket weighs 5.2kg when full of water. When half full, it weighs 3.1kg. What is the weight of the empty bucket?
A movie is 2.5 hours long. If you are 40% of the way through, how many minutes have you watched?
A tank is 2m long, 50cm wide, and 50cm deep. What is its volume in litres?
To measure the length of a pencil, would you use metres or centimetres?
To measure the weight of an apple, would you use kilograms or grams?
What is a good estimate for the length of a classroom: 10 centimetres or 10 metres?
You are measuring a small book. Would 20 cm or 20 m be a better estimate for its length?
To weigh a person, should you use grams or kilograms?
A ruler is used to measure length. What is the standard unit marked on a small school ruler?
A bag of sugar feels quite heavy. Would you expect it to weigh 1 gram or 1 kilogram?
Which unit would you use to measure the height of a door?
Which unit is best for measuring the weight of a single crisp?
Is the height of a house more likely to be 10 metres or 10 centimetres?
To weigh a large dog, which unit is more appropriate: g or kg?
You are measuring the width of your thumbnail. Which unit should you use, metres or centimetres?
What does a scale measure?
Estimate the length of a new pencil. Is it closer to 15cm or 15m?
A large bottle of water is likely to weigh 2 grams or 2 kilograms?
What tool do you use to measure length in centimetres?
Which is a better unit for the length of a bus: cm or m?
Which unit would you use for the weight of a feather?
Estimate the height of a coffee mug. Is it about 10cm or 10m?
You want to weigh a lorry. What unit should you use?
What is the most appropriate unit to measure the length of an ant?
A single grape would be weighed in grams or kilograms?
To measure the length of a football pitch, what is the best unit to use?
What tool do you use to measure your weight?
A small paperclip weighs about 1 gram. A bag of apples weighs about 1 kilogram. Which is heavier?
To measure the water in a swimming pool, would you use millilitres or litres?
What tool do you use to measure temperature?
A hot day in the UK might be 25 degrees what? (Celsius or kilograms)
A small glass of juice might hold 200 millilitres or 200 litres? Which is a better estimate?
What does a measuring jug measure?
Which is a hotter temperature for a sunny day: 5°C or 20°C?
To measure the amount of medicine on a spoon, which unit is best: litres or millilitres?
A reading on a thermometer is 10°C. Is it likely to be a hot summer day or a cool autumn day?
A bathtub holds about 150 litres. A swimming pool holds about 150,000 litres. Which unit is better for both?
What is the freezing point of water in degrees Celsius?
A can of fizzy drink holds 330ml. Is this more or less than a 1 litre bottle?
What is a typical room temperature in degrees Celsius? (10°C, 20°C, 30°C)
Which is the best tool to measure 500ml of water: a ruler, a scale, or a measuring jug?
A large bottle of cola is typically 2 litres or 2 millilitres?
A thermometer shows the temperature is -5°C. Is it cold enough for snow?
To measure the amount of fuel in a car, what unit would be used?
Estimate the capacity of a teacup. Is it closer to 250ml or 250l?
What is the boiling point of water in degrees Celsius?
A carton of milk is usually 1 litre. A small carton of cream is usually 300ml. Which holds more?
The temperature inside a fridge should be around 4°C. Is this warmer or colder than the freezing point of water?
Which unit would you use to measure a dose of cough syrup?
If you are measuring water for a recipe, what vessel would you use?
A hot oven might be at 200°C. Is this hotter or colder than boiling water?
A fish tank contains 60 litres of water. A puddle contains 600ml. Which contains less water?
What unit is represented by the symbol °C?
A ruler shows a line is exactly 8 centimetres long. How would you record this?
A recipe requires 250g of flour. What tool would you use to measure this?
A thermometer reads exactly halfway between 20°C and 30°C. What is the temperature?
A measuring jug is filled to the 500ml mark. What is this volume in litres?
To measure the width of a room, which tool is most appropriate: a 30cm ruler or a 5m tape measure?
A bag of apples weighs 1.2 kg. How many grams is this?
A line on a ruler starts at the 2cm mark and ends at the 9cm mark. How long is the line?
A thermometer shows the temperature is -2°C. How many degrees below freezing is this?
A jug has markings every 100ml. If the water level is on the 4th mark, how much water is in the jug?
You need to measure a football pitch. Would you choose metres or centimetres, and why?
correct_answer: Metres, because it is a large distance.

question_text: A digital scale reads 0.75 kg. What is this in grams?
The temperature drops from 5°C to -3°C. How many degrees has it fallen?
You pour three 200ml glasses of water from a 1 litre bottle. How much is left in the bottle?
A piece of ribbon is 1.5 metres long. How many 10cm pieces can you cut from it?
A scale is marked in kilograms. The needle is exactly between 2kg and 3kg. What is the weight in grams?
What is a sensible estimate for the capacity of a car's fuel tank: 50ml or 50 litres?
A fence is made of 5 sections, each 1.2m long. What is the total length of the fence?
The temperature of ice is -10°C. The temperature of boiling water is 100°C. What is the difference?
A recipe requires 0.25 litres of milk. Your measuring jug is marked in millilitres. How much do you need?
A room is 4.2 metres wide. Your tape measure is in centimetres. What should the measurement be?
Which is heavier: a 2kg bag of sugar or a 1500g bag of flour?
A thermometer reads 12°C. If it gets 15 degrees warmer, what will the new temperature be?
A bottle of medicine holds 100ml. Each dose is 5ml. How many doses are in the bottle?
A book is 2.5cm thick. What is this measurement in millimetres?
A bag of rice weighs 500g. How many of these bags would you need to have 3kg of rice?
A rectangular garden is 8m long and 5m wide. What is its perimeter?
A cake weighs 1.2kg. If it is cut into 8 equal slices, what is the weight of one slice in grams?
The temperature was -5°C at dawn and rose to 12°C by noon. By how many degrees did the temperature rise?
A jug contains 1.5 litres of water. You pour out 300ml. How many litres are left in the jug?
A race starts at 10:50 AM and finishes at 1:20 PM. How long did the race last in hours and minutes?
A room's floor is a square with a side length of 4m. What is the area of the floor in square metres?
A box contains 24 cans, each weighing 300g. The box itself weighs 500g. What is the total weight in kg?
If water flows into a tank at 20 litres per minute, how long will it take to fill a 1 kilolitre tank? (1kl = 1000l)
A TV programme is 45 minutes long. If it has 3 equal ad breaks that take up 1/5 of the total time, how long is each ad break?
Which is greater: the perimeter of a 6cm square or the perimeter of a 7cm by 4cm rectangle?
Which is greater: the perimeter of a 6cm square or the perimeter of a 8cm by 5cm rectangle?
You mix 500g of flour with 0.2kg of sugar and 50g of butter. What is the total weight of the mix in kg?
The temperature in a freezer is -18°C. The room temperature is 22°C. What is the temperature difference?
A bottle holds 2 litres. How many 125ml glasses can be filled from it?
A runner runs at an average speed of 10 km/h. How many metres does she run in 6 minutes?
What is the area of a rectangle with a length of 1.2m and a width of 50cm?
A recipe for 6 people needs 450g of flour. How much flour is needed for 8 people?
An athlete trains for 45 minutes every day. How many hours does she train in a week?
A bottle of water has a capacity of 750ml. What is the total capacity of 8 of these bottles in litres?
A train travels 30 miles in 20 minutes. What is its speed in miles per hour?
The area of a square is 25 square cm. What is its perimeter?
A bag contains 5kg of potatoes. 20% of the potatoes are bad. What is the weight of the good potatoes in grams?
A plane flies from 14:30 to 18:00. If its average speed is 500 mph, what is the distance of the flight?
A tap fills a 10 litre bucket in 4 minutes. What is the flow rate in litres per minute?
You mix 1.2 litres of juice with 800ml of water. What is the total volume of the drink?
A book is 18.2cm long. Estimate its length to the nearest whole centimetre.
Which is heavier: 350g or 305g?
What is the total of 250ml and 100ml?
An apple costs 30p and a banana costs 40p. What is the total cost?
A weight is 2.9kg. Estimate this to the nearest whole kilogram.
A comic costs £1.99 and a magazine costs £2.95. Estimate the total cost by rounding to the nearest pound.
What is 800g - 150g?
Which is shorter: 1.2m or 1.8m?
A bottle holds 1.1 litres. Estimate its capacity to the nearest whole litre.
You have a 5m rope and a 3m rope. What is their combined length?
Which holds more: a 500ml jug or a 450ml glass?
A pen costs 80p. A pencil costs 25p. What is the difference in price?
A book weighs 0.8kg. Estimate its weight to the nearest whole kg.
Calculate the total of 5.2m and 3.1m.
Compare 1.5 litres and 1.8 litres. Which is smaller?
You have £5. You spend £2.50. How much is left?
A cat weighs 4.6kg. What is this to the nearest whole kg?
Which is the greater amount of money: £9.50 or £9.05?
A bottle contains 750ml. You drink 150ml. What is the remaining volume?
A fence post is 2.1m tall. Estimate its height to the nearest metre.
Which is lighter: 0.7kg or 0.9kg?
A juice carton costs 99p. A bottle of water costs £1.50. Estimate the total to the nearest pound.
What is the sum of 120g and 130g?
Which is longer: 25cm or 20cm?
A bag of apples weighs 1.7kg. Estimate its weight to the nearest kg.
Which is longer: 1.2m or 130cm?
What is 1kg - 400g? Give your answer in grams.
You buy a comic for £2.50 and a drink for 80p. What is the total cost?
A bottle contains 2 litres of water. You pour out 750ml. How much is left in the bottle?
Which is heavier: 2.5kg or 2400g?
A builder has a plank of wood 3 metres long. He cuts off 80cm. How much is left in metres?
You have a £10 note. You buy a book for £6.50. How much change do you get?
What is the total of 1.5 litres and 800ml?
Which is shorter: 205cm or 2.5m?

You have £5. You buy a magazine for £3.20 and a chocolate bar for 90p. How much change do you get?

Which is heavier: a 2kg weight or three 700g weights?

What is the total length of a 1.8m plank and a 40cm plank?

Which is lighter: 0.9kg or 1100g?
You have a £1 coin. You buy a sweet for 45p. How much change do you get?
What is 2kg - 1200g?
A can holds 330ml. A bottle holds 0.5l. What is their total capacity?
A fence is 5m long. A gate that is 90cm wide is put in the middle. What is the total length now?
A bag of shopping weighs 3.2kg. You take out a 500g item. What is the new weight?
What is the change from £5 for items costing £1.50 and £2.10?
A runner runs 1.5km, then 800m, then 1.2km. What is the total distance in kilometres?
You have £100. You spend £45.50 and are given back £5.20. How much do you have now?
A bucket holding 5 litres of water has a leak. It loses 200ml every hour. How much is left after 5 hours?
A rectangular garden is 8m long and 4.5m wide. What is its perimeter?
Estimate the total weight of three items weighing 1.9kg, 2.8kg, and 0.9kg by rounding first.
A cafe sells coffee for £2.80 and cake for £3.50. You buy two coffees and one cake. What is the total?
A box contains 1.2kg of nails. If 100 nails weigh 200g, how many nails are in the box?
Which is the better value: a 2 litre bottle of juice for £3.00 or a 750ml bottle for £1.00?
A trip is 5km. You walk 1200m and then run for 2.5km. How much of the trip is left?
A container holds 2.5 litres. If it is 4/5 full, how many ml of liquid are in it?
A builder buys 5 bags of cement, each weighing 25kg. The total cost is £20. What is the cost per kg?
You have £50. You buy a jumper for £22.99 and a shirt for £15.50. How much money do you have left?
Find the difference between 3.2km and 1800m.
A recipe for 4 people needs 0.5kg of meat. How much meat is needed for 6 people?
Three parcels weigh 1.2kg, 950g, and 1.5kg. What is their average weight in kg?
Three parcels weigh 1.2kg, 900g, and 1.5kg. What is their average weight in kg?
A train travels 50 miles in 30 minutes. What is its speed in miles per hour?
A square garden has a perimeter of 18m. What is its area?
A tank holds 80 litres. It is 30% full. How many more litres are needed to make it 75% full?
Which is heavier: 20% of 5kg, or 75% of 1kg?
A bottle of 1 litre of olive oil costs £8. A can of 750ml costs £6.50. Which is better value for money?
A race starts at 11:40 and lasts for 1 hour and 35 minutes. What time does it finish?
A builder needs 5kg of cement. He has one bag of 2.5kg and one of 1800g. How much more does he need?
A cube has a side length of 10cm. What is its volume in litres?
A shop reduces a £80 coat by 25%. What is the sale price?
A car has a fuel efficiency of 50 miles per gallon. The tank holds 10 gallons. Fuel costs £1.50 per litre. How much does it cost to fill the tank from empty? (1 gallon ≈ 4.5 litres)
A rectangular swimming pool is 10m long, 4m wide and 1.5m deep. It is 80% full. What is the volume of water in the pool in litres?
Tom runs at 8 km/h. Jane starts 15 minutes after him from the same point, running at 10 km/h. How long does it take Jane to catch Tom?
A shop buys a coat for £40. They add a 50% markup. Then they offer a 20% discount in a sale. What is the final price?
A cube has a volume of 8 cubic cm. Its side length is 2cm. If you double the side length, what is the new volume?
Justify your choice of units (mm, cm, m, km) for measuring: a) the thickness of a coin, b) the length of a bus, c) the distance to the next city.
Find the error: A room is 3m by 4m, so its perimeter is 12m.
correct_answer: That is the area, not perimeter

question_text: You have 5 litres of a 10% salt solution. How many grams of salt are in the solution if 1 litre of water weighs 1kg?
An empty lorry weighs 2.5 tonnes. It is loaded with 50 boxes, each weighing 20kg. What is the total weight of the loaded lorry?
A plane travels at 500 mph. How many minutes does it take to travel 125 miles?
A recipe for 12 cookies needs 150g of sugar. You want to make 30 cookies. How much sugar do you need?
You have £50. You buy a shirt for £15.99 and shoes for £24.99. You think you have about £10 left. Is your estimate reasonable? Explain.
A tap fills a 20-litre bucket in 5 minutes. A hole at the bottom leaks 1 litre per minute. How long will it take to fill the bucket?
A square has an area of 64 sq m. A smaller square has a perimeter that is half of the first square. What is the area of the smaller square?
A train leaves at 08:30 and arrives at 11:00. It travels 150 miles. What was its average speed?
A 2kg bag of flour costs £1.20. A 1.5kg bag costs 93p. Which is better value?
A 2kg bag of flour costs £1.20. A 1.5kg bag costs 84p. Which is better value?
A fish tank is 50cm long, 30cm wide, and 40cm high. It is filled to 2cm from the top. What is the volume of water in litres?
A bill is £80 + 20% VAT. You have a voucher for 10% off the total price. What do you pay?
What is the most appropriate estimate for the mass of a large car: 1500g, 150kg, or 1.5 tonnes?
An object has a volume of 50 cm³. The material weighs 8g per cm³. What is the total mass of the object in kg?
A garden is 10m by 12m. 25% of it is patio. What is the area of the lawn?
A plane flies for 3 hours. For the first hour, it travels 400 miles. For the next two, 500 mph. What is the average speed for the whole journey?
A 1 litre bottle of water freezes and expands by 10%. What is the new volume in cm³?
You have a £100 gift card. You buy items costing £12.50, £35.99, and £42.00. How much is left on the card?
